meanings.definition: To impose a tax on (something) again.
meanings.sent1: The government decided to retax the citizens for road repairs.
meanings.sent2: The city council voted to retax the properties in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: It seems like they are always retaxing us for something new!
meanings.sent4: The idea to retax the businesses was like squeezing water from a stone.
meanings.sent5: The thought of retaxing the population made the politicians unpopular.

meanings.definition: To levy a tax on (something) for a second time.
meanings.sent1: The council's decision to retax the properties surprised many residents.
meanings.sent2: The government's plan to retax the income of the wealthy caused controversy.
meanings.sent3: People were retaxing their brains trying to understand the new tax law.
meanings.sent4: The decision to retax the imported goods was a heavy blow to the economy.
meanings.sent5: The idea to retax the citizens' savings accounts was met with strong opposition.
